## **1. Create the Base Quarto Website Using the CLI (Recommended)**

Educators should begin by using the built-in Quarto command:

```bash
quarto create project website <name-of-project>
```

Example:

```bash
quarto create project website CloudAnalyticsCourse
```

This automatically creates:

```
CloudAnalyticsCourse/
  â”œâ”€â”€ _quarto.yml
  â”œâ”€â”€ index.qmd
  â””â”€â”€ styles.css   (depending on template)
```

Now open the folder in VS Code, RStudio, or any preferred editor.

---

## **2. Replace the Default Pages With Your Course Pages**

In the root of the project, create the standard site pages:

```
index.qmd
syllabus.qmd
deliverables.qmd
schedule.qmd
todo.qmd          # Instructor-only checklist
```

**Purpose of Each Page**

* **index.qmd** â†’ Course homepage
* **syllabus.qmd** â†’ Course policies
* **deliverables.qmd** â†’ Assignments & grading
* **schedule.qmd** â†’ Module or weekly timeline
* **todo.qmd** â†’ Instructor checklists

---

## **3. Create Module Folders (M0â€“M8)**

In your project folder, add:

```
M0/
M1/
M2/
M3/
M4/
M5/
M6/

```

Nine modules total.

---

## **4. Inside Each Module Folder, Add the Standard File Structure**

For example, inside **M1/** create:

```
M1_LN1.qmd        # Lecture Note 1
M1_LN2.qmd        # Lecture Note 2
M1_P1.qmd         # Presentation 1
M1_P2.qmd         # Presentation 2
M1_T1.qmd         # Tutorial 1
M1_T2.qmd         # Tutorial 2
M1_Lab1.qmd       # Lab 1
M1_Lab2.qmd       # Lab 2
M1_A.qmd          # Assignment
M1_Proj.qmd       # Project step
M1_highlights.qmd # Summary landing page
M1L1_figures/
M1L2_figures/
```

Copy this structure for **every module** from 0â€“8, adjusting the naming prefix.

---

## **5. Update `_quarto.yml` to Configure the Microsite**

Replace the default file created by Quarto CLI with a course-oriented version:

```yaml
project:
  type: website

website:
  title: "Course Name"
  navbar:
    left:
      - href: index.qmd
        text: Home
      - href: syllabus.qmd
        text: Syllabus
      - href: deliverables.qmd
        text: Deliverables
      - href: schedule.qmd
        text: Schedule
      - text: Modules
        menu:
          - text: Module 0
            href: M0/M0_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 1
            href: M1/M1_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 2
            href: M2/M2_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 3
            href: M3/M3_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 4
            href: M4/M4_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 5
            href: M5/M5_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 6
            href: M6/M6_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 7
            href: M7/M7_highlights.qmd
          - text: Module 8
            href: M8/M8_highlights.qmd

format:
  html:
    theme: cosmo
    toc: true
```

This creates a clean navigation system, anchored around module highlights pages.

## **7. Build an Instructor TODO Website**

Create `todo.qmd`:

```yaml
---
title: "Instructor TODO Checklist"
format: html
---

# Course-Level Tasks
- [ ] Update syllabus
- [ ] Customize schedule
- [ ] Adjust grading/deliverables

# Module Tasks (Repeat for Each Module)
## Module 1
- [ ] Lecture Note 1
- [ ] Lecture Note 2
- [ ] Presentation 1
- [ ] Presentation 2
- [ ] Tutorial 1
- [ ] Tutorial 2
- [ ] Lab 1
- [ ] Lab 2
- [ ] Assignment
- [ ] Project Step
- [ ] Highlights Page
```

Educators can check tasks off during development.

---

## **8. Render the Website**

Once content is ready, educators run:

```bash
quarto render
```

Or click **Render Website** if using RStudio.
